content: First attempt at an event for b.org, could use a review: https://backdropcms.org/news/events/backdrop-live
Hmm :thinking: ...not sure that requiring a registration fee for this first event is a good idea (sorry, I got distracted by other work and I missed that when it was being discussed)

...the agency I work for has been contacting Drupal trainings (GovCMS specifically), and we have now switched to remote ones, due to COVID and all. The first one we conducted was free, as we treated it as a "pilot".
...perhaps we should treat this first Backdrop event as a pilot too. Once we have a better "feel", we can start asking for a fee - I'd hate the fee to be a barrier for people to attend.
I would love it if the software we end up using has the ability to "switch rooms", and allow people to form topic-specific rooms on-the-fly.
I think that what we decided was a "suggested donation." We definitely decided that a fee should not be required, only encouraged as a kind of donation.
That's sounds fine then :+1:
This event will be online-only, and cost only $20 to attend (scholarships available).
^^ this bit will need updating then, to reflect that.
Yeah, we can work on the exact wording.

How about something like this instead:

This event will be online-only. Attending is free, but donations are welcome, with a suggested amount of $20.
It'd be nice to know the times this is on, for those in different timezones...
Ahhhhh, good point. We didn't address that yet.

I am creating issues for Backdrop CMS Live - https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/692

[Meta] Planning for Backdrop CMS LIVE event on Sept 18th and 19th, 2020 · Issue #692 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
We had the first planning meeting for our first full day Backdrop CMS only event today. Creating this as a meta issue to link to all the individual tasks that we need to complete. Current plans: Pl...

@jenlampton or @Luke McCormick
DRAFT: https://backdropcms.org/news/backdrop-cms-live-sept-18-19-2020
@StPaulTim I also love to over-comma :)

I quietly posted this "Save the Date" blog post for Backdrop CMS Live event on Sept 18-19. It's not too late for feedback or comments.

https://backdropcms.org/news/backdrop-cms-live-sept-18-19-2020

jenlampton said:

StPaulTim I also love to over-comma :smile:

Me too :sweat_smile:
The blog post looks good @StPaulTim ++
stpaultim :pancakes: (Karma: 20)

...but https://backdropcms.org/newsletter needs some love. Should we be conditionally hiding the newsletter block from that page @jenlampton ? ...also, the black background color makes the page look broken :disappointed:

Hi...

A suggestion if I may :-)

Just visited the link and where is say's

Registration: Sign up for announcements

I thought I was signing up receive notifications for the event, but it turns out I was signing up to the newsletter which I had already signed up for.

While the nuances of the wording suggest you are signing up to be notified of the even and while I appreciate that the newsletter will contain information about the event, it's not clear from the wording :-)

Hope that makes sense :smile: and I'm not nitpicking :-) honest :-)

Hope it helps :smile:
@Steve Moorhouse I felt the same.
Who said nitpicking is bad? What you said makes sense @Steve Moorhouse

I spend some time on Sunday updating github issues for Backdrop CMS Live event.
https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/692

This week is Outreach meeting week. We should either devote our meeting this week to this event OR get another dedicated meeting on the schedule. @Luke McCormick do you think you will be at Outreach meeting this week or should we schedule a different time that works better for you?

[Meta] BDLIVE - Planning for Backdrop CMS LIVE event on Sept 18th and 19th, 2020 · Issue #692 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
We had the first planning meeting for our first full day Backdrop CMS only event today. Creating this as a meta issue to link to all the individual tasks that we need to complete. Current plans: Pl...
@StPaulTim ++
stpaultim great work (Karma: 21)
I should be able to make the Outreach meeting tomorrow

For those who are interested in the draft website for Backdrop CMS Live
http://backdropcmslive.simplo.site/

For those who were not in the meeting, the BackdropCMS live website is mostly DEMO content and proof of concept features. It basically works, but it's not quite ready for prime time.

@jenlampton and I will review the features and are looking at whether we have time to add site registration/payments.
Feel free to create an account on the site, recognizing that it's still a test version and your account may not last (but probably will).
Also - I don't think it's critical. BUT, if someone has time and inspiration to create a logo/graphic for Backdrop CMS Live (2020), that could be cool!

https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/700

BLIVE - Website · Issue #700 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
So, against our better judgement we've embarked on the path of creating a website for Backdrop CMS Live. http://backdropcmslive.simplo.site/ It's still in development and ready for public u...
We also decided to create an "event planning" stream, because we could start seeing lots of traffic for Backdrop CMS Live. I'll do that now.
Should we move this thread to that new stream then @StPaulTim ?
I think it's ok to leave some of the discussion here in the main channel. I assume that this thread will be useful in the future, when we want to post updates to the larger community.

If we do a Backdrop CMS Live event planning meeting on Thurs/Fri at:

Oakland - Thurs 11:00pm
Minnesota - Friday 1:00am
Berlin - 8:00am
Sydney - 4:00pm

Would that make it possible for anyone to participate that 1) wants to participate 2) Is usually unable to participate
@mazze.ch @BWPanda @Olaf Grabienski @Robert Garrigos @indigoxela @Tuhin @Alan Mels or anyone else?

We'd like some assurances that this would be helpful to someone before we try it.
NOTE: I suppose all the people who would benefit from this are sleeping right now, so I'll wait until tomorrow for replies. :-)
REMINDER: If you are interested in event planning, please join our event planning stream.
here?
Yes
No, not here.
If you have started on .... oh
I'll join the stream, but I will not be able to attend this meeting. I'm on hollydays and away of a computer.

I'd love to attend the live event if possible, depending how work and family life let me, however I'm not sure how much input I'll be able to have in planning it (I'll probably just be a participant). Having said that, 4pm works ok for me if the meeting starts on time. Otherwise at 5pm I have another meeting and then dinner straight after.
Hi @StPaulTim unfortunately I can't make it to the meeting this Friday, although the meeting would be good for most Fridays throughout the year:-(
@StPaulTim Don't have much time to do actual planning but Friday 8am would work for me.

Registration is officially open. Who will be first?
I won't push this to social media for an hour or two, so that friends and family can review and/or test. At least, take a look and let us know if you see anything that needs to be addressed.

https://backdrop-live.backdropcms.org/
Well I was almost first, but I've met a tiny snag: the form asks for my timezone, and its a required field. What is a timezone? Do I put in my country, GMT -5, EST, not sure.
Also, the form is within a frame with a limited height, so you have to scroll within the page scroll. Can we make the form's frame MUCH longer so only the page needs to scroll? Its a bit tedious.

docwilmot said:

Well I was almost first, but I've met a tiny snag: the form asks for my timezone, and its a required field. What is a timezone? Do I put in my country, GMT -5, EST, not sure.

We were concerned about that. We don't have the option to validate this in any way, so we're hoping that people fill it in however they choose and that we just figure it out based upon this field AND their city/country. But, providing some help text might be good.
And why is "What time of day are you able to participate in or facilitate conversations (in your local time zone)? " a required field?
We could enter all 24 time zones in a select list, but we'd have to add them all ourselves.
Because we are trying to figure out the best time to schedule sessions. If we make that optional and no one answers it, it will be harder to create the schedule.
But, we could change that if it doesn't make sense to people. Either provide more info or make it optional.
I think the time of day field was mostly for people who volunteer to facilitate. So we could make that an optional field ONLY for people who indicate they are interested in facilitating.
We can make general assumptions about scheduling from time zone alone.
But for folks interested in facilitating, a little more info would be helpful.
@jenlampton and I worked through the form together. But, we appreciate additional feedback.

I think leave the time/zone required, just add better help text:

We will try to schedule sessions based on participants' preferred times. Please let us know when you're able to attend.
But make it clearer what to put there: a time, a location, a GMT-x etc
Still not sure
I am inclined to keep that time zone field with better help text required, but make the field about "What are the best time of day" field only for people interested in facilitating.

docwilmot said:

But make it clearer what to put there: a time, a location, a GMT-x etc

The problem is, I don't know what to ask people for that will make sense to everyone and not prevent them from filling out the form. I just want people to put whatever information is easy for them in that field.

I am inclined to keep that time zone field with better help text required, but make the field about "What are the best time of day" field only for people interested in facilitating.

Its difficult because that could be a complete mishmash (7-9, 11-12.30 then free from 18.00 to 20.45, then ...). Whos gonna parse that for all registrants?

Its difficult because that could be a complete mishmash (7-9, 11-12.30 then free from 18.00 to 20.45, then ...). Whos gonna parse that for all registrants?

Agreed. But, lacking better alternatives, I'm willing to weed through the mismash.
But, I'm open to better alternatives that work with the options available in Eventbrite.
(please note I'm indeed trying to be critical)
We basically have the option of short text field, long text field, select list (custom options), radio buttons.

(please note I'm indeed trying to be critical)

No worries. I appreciate the critical feedback.
Can we not parse the timezone from the country and eleminate that question?
and re time of day. a checkbox list with 2 - hour blocks would be a manageable 12 options.

Can we not parse the timezone from the country and eleminate that question?

I think this is a good point. Between city and country, we might have all the info we need - and avoid putting an ambigious question in front of people that might slow them down.

@jenlampton and I spent some time thinking about this and were not entirely happy with the outcome. I think just asking for city/country alone is probably enough and will be easier for users to understand.
p.s. my registration timed out :laughing:
I extended it to 15 minutes from default of 7 minutes.
Hopefully most people will be able to finish in 15 minutes.
Although, we're not going to sell out, so I don't know why we need a time limit anyway.
7 would be fine i'm sure, as long as the registrant doesnt pause to ask you questions
I do not plan to offer 24 hour chat support for everyone. Only our beta testers.
Taking dinner break. Will make some adjustments to form after dinner, based upon your feedback.
also remove the account menu block title in the footer
I removed the menu block, added a select list of 24 time zone options, AND moved the "best times of the day" question to only show up for people who volunteer to facilitate.
Thanks for feedback.
"Would you like to volunteer as part of the Backdrop CMS project?" could maybe use an option for people already doing it.
And an error in one option: "Help build or improve themes and modules that can be added to Backdrop CMSCMS" (double CMS)
Thanks

Under "Are you willing to facilitate any conversations?" could we just put back the same checkbox list so I dont need to type them? (theyre right there in the previous question, seems unnecesary to have to copy paste them)
@docwilmot - Done and Done
No one has completed a registration yet. It's not too late to be first.
First then
@docwilmot is the winner!
yay!!
was much better this time
except i didnt know what utc is either
:smile:
Really?

except i didnt know what utc is either

Part of the reason for not doing this from the start is that there are lots of different ways that people think about or describe Time Zones. UTC seems to be the most common, so I decided to go with that.

i should explain, before @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) thinks i'm an idiot, i knew of utc but had to google which option matched my timezone. my googling included "difference b/w utc and gmt" and "what is my utc time zone", etc. :laughing: sorry

We thought about using blocks of time, but if we asked about three-hpur
blocks of time (marching our schedule) what time zone should we use?
You mean for the "what time you available" question? I imagine that without providing blocks the user would write in his own timezones. "I'm available at 3pm" for example.
I suspect that question is not going to be too helpful.

We are going to go ahead with a planning meeting for Backdrop CMS Live at a special time tomorrow to try and reach a few more folks from other regions of the globe.

This will be a chance to ask questions and provide feedback on the event, even if you are not able to provide much help with the planning. 11:00PM Thur Pacific Time, 8:00AM Fri in Germany, and 4PM Fri in Sydney, Australia.

https://backdropcms.org/news/events/backdrop-cms-live-planning-meeting
Also, please help spread the word about Backdrop CMS Live in your social media channels.

I've asked someone to cover for me at work, so will most likely make it :+1:

I also have a "restream" account so if you need to stream to a couple of different sources at the same time i.e. facebook and youtube I can help with that.
Interesting. I don't think we've considered a live stream yet, but I see some real value in live streaming at least 2-3 sessions in the way that the Driesnote is usually streamed live at Drupalcon.
Let's think about and talk abou that.

It's scheduled! ;-)
@StPaulTim Suggested discussion: Porting of Drupal 7 modules
@Attila Vasas - will you be there?
I'm sorry, my english knowledge is poor, it is hard for me to understand the spoken english. :sad:
@Attila Vasas Where are you from?
Hungary
Are there many Hungarians that might be interested in Backdrop CMS?
I'm afraid not. Only a few hungarian sites mention Backdrop CMS.
Well, thanks for suggesting topic. I think Porting of Drupal 7 modules is a good topic.
If you have ideas about how to tell more Hungarians about Backdrop CMS, please let us know.
Thanks for your help!
Gladly :smile:
Will the sessions all be recorded? My holiday starts on the 18th and goes through the 19th.
I wouldn't call 2 days much of a holiday.
@StPaulTim I just had an idea! We should tweet about #BackdropLIVE with #BackdropLOVE
I just did that by accident and thought "!!!"

At the outreach meeting, we talked about how to get more people trying BackDrop. The thought at the time was that it's the developers who need to try it out because businesses should have a tech person, a web person, or internal developer type, who does the web site for the business. So the focus is attracting existing web developers, like Drupal 7 developers.

My thought is that there are millions of people out of work and millions of small businesses that don't have a web presence. Many people have lost their jobs (about 50 million) and are needing to create some kind for work for themselves. These could be massage therapists, authors, woodworkers, painters, repair in various industries, etc. They are mom and pop businesses and they don't have a tech and don't have money to hire professional developers. I was once quoted $4000 to upgrade my site. New home businesses can't spend money like that. But they need to be on the web, otherwise they are invisible.

We need to make BackDrop even more friendly for very small businesses and non-profits to create a web site. I suggest that BackDrop Live could explore how we could help these millions of people create work for themselves and create a web presence to promote themselves. I have one of these small businesses myself and it took me years to create my Drupal 7 sites. It was hard. My wife also is starting a small business. She tried to become a front end developer and spent two years studying. She finally gave up. Too difficult, to much complexity.

Now she is starting a machine embroidery design business. For a web presence she is using WordPress, because it is easy to get installed and use. Media, Photos and Video are ready to go at the install. BackDrop should be the easiest and also the most powerful CMS for these millions of people. We need to make the documentation and process very straightforward. Step by step. Everything should be ready so that installation is a breeze and putting up pages with photos and YouTube videos is ready to go.

Just some thoughts to consider.
I'm working on "The Ultimate Guide to BackDrop for Beginners" that will start this process going.
I'm just documenting all my trials and tribulations to find all the weak points in the process of creating a BackDrop web site.

I just had an idea! We should tweet about #BackdropLIVE with #BackdropLOVE

Just to clarify what should be obvious, you mean to use the hashtags #BackdropLIVE and #BackdropLOVE?

oadaeh (Jason Flatt) said:

I wouldn't call 2 days much of a holiday.

oadaeh (Jason Flatt) said:

I wouldn't call 2 days much of a holiday.

It's not up to me - it's a religious holiday. Not a vacation day.

Will the sessions all be recorded? My holiday starts on the 18th and goes through the 19th.

We have not yet decided on a recording policy. I think we will try to record some sessions, but my preference would be that we not try to record them all. If there are some formal presentations, they are good candidates to be recorded. But, we want to encourage participation and interaction in many of the discussions and I think that some people are less likely to participate actively if they think it will end up on YouTube.
My thought is that we try to record approximately half of the sessions, but leave half without recording. Input and feedback welcome.

Sarvasri said:

At the outreach meeting, we talked about how to get more people trying BackDrop. The thought at the time was that it's the developers who need to try it out because businesses should have a tech person, a web person, or internal developer type, who does the web site for the business. So the focus is attracting existing web developers, like Drupal 7 developers.

My thought is that there are millions of people out of work and millions of small businesses that don't have a web presence. Many people have lost their jobs (about 50 million) and are needing to create some kind for work for themselves. These could be massage therapists, authors, woodworkers, painters, repair in various industries, etc. They are mom and pop businesses and they don't have a tech and don't have money to hire professional developers. I was once quoted $4000 to upgrade my site. New home businesses can't spend money like that. But they need to be on the web, otherwise they are invisible.

We need to make BackDrop even more friendly for very small businesses and non-profits to create a web site. I suggest that BackDrop Live could explore how we could help these millions of people create work for themselves and create a web presence to promote themselves. I have one of these small businesses myself and it took me years to create my Drupal 7 sites. It was hard. My wife also is starting a small business. She tried to become a front end developer and spent two years studying. She finally gave up. Too difficult, to much complexity.

Now she is starting a machine embroidery design business. For a web presence she is using WordPress, because it is easy to get installed and use. Media, Photos and Video are ready to go at the install. BackDrop should be the easiest and also the most powerful CMS for these millions of people. We need to make the documentation and process very straightforward. Step by step. Everything should be ready so that installation is a breeze and putting up pages with photos and YouTube videos is ready to go.

Just some thoughts to consider.
I'm working on "The Ultimate Guide to BackDrop for Beginners" that will start this process going.
I'm just documenting all my trials and tribulations to find all the weak points in the process of creating a BackDrop web site.

@Sarvasri - Just my opinion, but Backdrop is not going to win a competition with Wordpress for the very small bottom end sites. There's too much competition already and it doesn't bring anything of value that the others don't already have to a complete novice. Where Backdrop really shines is where D7 used to be - the one up from small scale, where there will be multiple users and/or lots of content and some complexity. Wordpress sucks when you start getting into the more complex stuff like group permissions and file management. It doesn't have much for that out of the box and all the tools have to essentially sit on top of Wordpress, not well integrated. I also found Backdrop/Ubercart to be a much better performer and much more competitive for a small to medium e-commerce store than Wordpress is. I have stores on both, and Wordpress definitely lags compared to Backdrop in function, performance and usability. It's perfect for the $1500 and up sites. I even prefer it with the smaller sites if the customer doesn't have preference. We're a small agency, so I don't have the resources for D8 or D9 and my clients aren't willing to pay for it. They will pay for Backdrop or Wordpress.

StPaulTim said:

Will the sessions all be recorded? My holiday starts on the 18th and goes through the 19th.

We have not yet decided on a recording policy. I think we will try to record some sessions, but my preference would be that we not try to record them all. If there are some formal presentations, they are good candidates to be recorded. But, we want to encourage participation and interaction in many of the discussions and I think that some people are less likely to participate actively if they think it will end up on YouTube.

@StPaulTim, I have a religious holiday on the 18th and 19th - there's no way I can make those sessions. I am registered. The recordings could be available to those who registered only (and paid ... :-) ). That might be a nice compromise. I don't need or want them on Youtube.

Elisabeth

The recordings could be available to those who registered only (and paid ... :-) ). That might be a nice compromise. I don't need or want them on Youtube.

I think we are going to want to record and share as much as possible. I'll see what others think about the idea of recording all sessions, but not posting them all to YouTube (publicly). I'm trying to find a way to respect the fact that some people are uncomfortable being recorded in a session format that is encouraging participation.

Most recorded sessions are presentations and the audience is not visible. That won't be the case for many of our sessions.

We are looking for someone to facilitate a discussion on porting Drupal 7 modules to Backdrop for Backdrop CMS LIVE event. You don't have to prepare a presentation, just have the ability and interest to answer some questions and facilitate a discussion.

If you are the facilitator, you get to help select the time slot and write the description. I started a draft description, but you can edit it or rewrite if from scratch if you like or have a different idea.
https://backdrop-live.backdropcms.org/session/porting-drupal-7-modules-to-backdrop-cms
Is anyone available to look at a draft email newsletter (for Backdrop LIVE)?
I can
I just sent a test email to you.
What sort of feedback are you wanting?

Good question. :-)

I suppose, I'm open to anything.
1) Ideas to make it more effective (content or otherwise)?
2) Is the text clear and do you see any errors?
I suppose the biggest thing I'm looking for are ideas to increase it's effectiveness.
Effectiveness = motivating people to register.
I remember one thing I've been taught over the years along those lines: tell people how something will benefit them. Focus on them and their point of view.
I'd remove the word 'relatively' from the first paragraph.

And I think the paragraph between the 'Here are some of the sessions we have scheduled so far:' heading and the list of scheduled sessions isn't needed and can be removed. It seems to just duplicate what's said above.
Also, the Register link under the $20 donation section seems to be off-centre and a bit small. Not sure if there's a styling issue there...
Just sent out an email about this to a subset of my clients I thought might be interested.
Very cool!

The only problem I foresee (looking at this from my client's POV) is that it might be hard for them to attend sessions they are interested in based on the timezones. E.g. "I'd like to attend this, this and this session. Oh, they're all scheduled to be late night or early morning for me. Guess there's no point registering then..."

I know this isn't fixable because someone is always going to be disadvantaged by the timezones, but just pointing out this might be why people choose not to register, because their preferred sessions are at the wrong times for them.

@BWPanda - That is unfortunately true. We deliberately set out to create a schedule that would provide at least some opportunities for participation in every time zone. We can provide more opportunities in other time zones, if more people are willing to host sessions at those times.

StPaulTim said:

We are looking for someone to facilitate a discussion on porting Drupal 7 modules to Backdrop for Backdrop CMS LIVE event. You don't have to prepare a presentation, just have the ability and interest to answer some questions and facilitate a discussion.

I could facilitate this I suppose; I have ported quite a few. Let me know whats involved.

We just added "Hax The Backdrop" to the Backdrop LIVE schedule.
https://backdrop-live.backdropcms.org/session/hax-the-backdrop

I could facilitate this I suppose; I have ported quite a few. Let me know whats involved.

@docwilmot Thanks for that offer. Let me ping you privately about scheduling this.
@StPaulTim you mentioned me helping with porting modules. I could though I thought originally we were chatting about d7 site to backdrop upgrade. Unless @jenlampton is doing that
Whoops, your right. Sorry that was my mistake.
Too many conversations going on at once.
@Herb - D7 Upgrades is probably better.
Thanks

We just added a session/topic hosted by @oadaeh (Jason Flatt)
https://backdrop-live.backdropcms.org/session/automating-and-simplifying-the-set-up-maintenance-and-hosting-of-backdrop-cms-sites
Also too tired for today’s meetings, after a long walk with Quincy (dog), but I will write a blog post for LIVE this weekend, promised:-)
@quicksketch - Can we sign you up to host a topic?

We really need some folks to host topics in our European time slots. Anyone in Europe have a topic they want to see discussed?

NOTE: We can repeat topics more than once.

The responsibilities of a topic host are simply to convene the discussion and ask / answer questions as you are able. No presentation is required, but if you have a short demonstration to share, that would be great.

UPDATES:

1) We have 18 official registrations so far, with several folks who have said they are coming but not yet registered. I hope to see that double this week (my goal is 50 people). We have registrations from Peru, Canada, UK, Germany, Zambia, USA, Cayman Islands, and Greece.

2) If you want to be more involved or get more frequent updates, join the "Event Planning" stream.

3) We are still looking for more topic hosts. Let us know what topics that you would like to see added to the schedule. We would love more topics for our European time slots.

4) We are recommending a $20 donation with registration, but will accept any amount AND we have free tickets available for anyone that requests one. We want anyone to attend that is interested.
Someone suggested "E-Commerce" as a topic for Backdrop LIVE. Any thoughts?

I had a discussion over the phone with a person from Greece (co-owner of a 2-man digital agency) that recently registered an account in localize.b.org ...he said that he's been keeping an eye in Backdrop, and he also noticed increased interest/activity. He mentioned e-com and that he's aware that we don't have ported https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/commerce properly, and that he knows that people have been suggesting https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/ubercart instead ...I said that from memory, people mentioned stripe has been working great for them.

backdrop-contrib/commerce
Contribute to backdrop-contrib/commerce development by creating an account on GitHub.
backdrop-contrib/ubercart

https://github.com/btopro/backdrop-logo -- Example Web component demo'ed tonight made just for back drop. Takes the logo from the backdrop live website and tries to make it something reusable in other contexts

btopro/backdrop-logo
Backdrop CMS logo web component. Contribute to btopro/backdrop-logo development by creating an account on GitHub.
@Bryan Ollendyke that was really cool. Got me thinking about lots of stuff. My organization tries to have similar themes with multiple platforms. Web component for a logo...interesting.

@Justin Keiser Glad to hear that thank you. Here is what initially inspired our team way back when -- http://webcomponents.byu.edu/ . ONLY design assets but last I talked to them they said that 10,000+ properties use this and they stop caring about platforms, let the web handle handle the details and the templating engine in whatever the platform is just has to know how to load it :)

They don't have a "Magic script" but it's close. Theirs loads all 26 definitions (so hit 1 BYU site, now all the rest will load faster) while our approach is to lazy-load EVERYTHING and let the application decide what pieces it needs. You can see the registry file (tooling auto-gens it) which is the list of tags and where it should go look to load it -- https://cdn.webcomponents.psu.edu/cdn/wc-registry.json . Then the magic script sees a new tag in the DOM, if that tag matches the registry, boom, imports the definition :)

documentation on how to handle tools can be found here: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/ctools/wiki/How-to-port-modules-that-used-ctools-to-their-Backdrop-equivalents

backdrop-contrib/ctools
This suite is primarily a set of APIs and tools to improve the developer experience. - backdrop-contrib/ctools

coder review and coder upgrade modules: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/coder_review https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/coder_upgrade

backdrop-contrib/coder_review
"Developer module" which reviews your code identifying coding style problems and where updates to the API are required. - backdrop-contrib/coder_review
backdrop-contrib/coder_upgrade
Helps automate some/most of the work required to upgrade a module from Drupal to Backdrop 1.x - backdrop-contrib/coder_upgrade

Herb said:

I can't recall if Drupal 7 already stopped supporting other template engines. Or if you still could like in d6

the theme rendering process in D7 basically killed all non-phptemplate theme engines. The hard-coded render() in templates, the page array, the process and preprocess layers, it became nearly impossible to support them.
they were technically supported, but completely impractical -- sort of like using posgress for the database. Most of contrib and much of core didn't take them into account.
We're in the same boat in Backdrop, but minus the page array and process layers it might be slightly easier to support them... afaik nobody has tried
